reviews.review_msg: Prof is very nice and intelligent but if you don't like learning be prepared to listen to long long lectures and assignments that may not make sense but you can BS with at least a C+

Professor Mitchell is kind and welcoming, and clearly really cares about student wellbeing (and takes their feedback seriously). She's also very clear and effective in her lectures, and teaches really interesting content. I really enjoyed this class and would definitely take this prof again.

There are two open-book exams that contain two essays, but make sure you keep up with the readings and add terminology. We did discussions in assigned small groups and wrote a paper on the information after our turn as the leader. They were based on the topic of the lecture that week and helped for understanding the topic of the week.

Professor Mitchell is one of the best profs I've had in my time at university. She is very caring and supportive, recognizes when it is a stressful time of the semester, and gives substantial feedback (which is rare while courses are online). Her layout of the course was also very manageable. I took SA 231 with her in the past, highly recommend.

Incredibly helpful, organized, knowledgeable, fair and kind! She respects her students and is quick to respond by email (super appreciated for online course). Quite a bit of material and she's not an easy marker but honestly I learned so much. She gives clear, detailed examples/expectations for all assignments. Would recommend.
love this prof! super organized  clear and very  experienced

Barbara is a great prof. She made this course as easy as possible however the whole course and statistics were hard for me because I am not good at it ! but she really tries to makes it easy for students and gives tests to break the grade number and if you read her stuff you can ace the tests

Barbara is a good prof, she is passionate and I love that in teachers. You must put in the work to get a good grade (like any class!) She is very critical which makes her grading tough but she is very clear in what she wants and I enjoyed her lectures.

Here's the deal with Barbara. What she wants for the term paper or presentation, depends on her mood, when you ask her& who asks it. So the best strategy is to be there at all times when people are asking Qs so you can write down everything & find the common ground and use that. definitely a tough marker as well.  Never gives out perfect score...

She is a nice person but her expectations for assignments are not clear. She also uses a test bank which she does not proof before handing out. Attending lecture is not essential although one or two questions are usually asked on the documentaries.

Great course with interesting material and documentaries! Very fair marker with lots of choice on tests and combo of short answers and essay. Class presentations a bit boring but helpful for improving proposal and final project that is major part of grade. Would recommend to other students.

She means well and is kind... However I would not take her class again. She is quite full of herself and likes to ramble on and on about nothing. She doesn't answer your questions very clearly and expects far too much from students on the term paper (15 pages!). Her exams are sort of weird too... all short answer. Not my fave prof at all

She was very enthusiastic and interested in the topic. Quantitative Research in general is a bit complicated but it seemed like she tried to make things as easy as possible for us. Gives you lots of class time to work on projects. If you just go talk to her she'll give you ideas and help you with any problems. I enjoyed her class.

Excellent prof; very easy to understand and knows what she is doing. I learned a lot this semester. She is very understanding but can be dismissive out of class. Either way, I would take a course with her again.

She can't teach very well, but is approachable if you have any questions to ask her. The 13 page term paper is kind of a lot for a second year course and you have to do all your own research. The midterm and final are reasonable but you have to memorize the whole textbook in order to do well because she doesn't teach most of the concepts in class.
